one_reviews_text:
I just have to praise the  makers of this game. I bought this game and out of the box was having problems; I could not connect to multiplayer servers at all. A quicjk email to support and they had me fixed up super quick.

For the game itself, it is fun. The mechinics can be a little daunting to get the hang of but the concept is fun and a great workout. I'm sure with practice I'll get good at it but for now it is fun trying.

review_title: Run, Jump, and sweat like heck!
one_reviews_text: If you thought Beatsaber was a workout, just give this game five minutes of your time and you'll come to realize how many towels you'll need. Looking at this game critically, I say that it is a perfect concept for a vr racing game, rather than being stuck in a vehicle, you are the vehicle. The mix of Mariokart esque power ups and the movement of Jet Set Radio Future blend incredbly well and lend themselves to a unique experience! That being said however, for any new player it will take a few days to grasp the running mechanic, but once you do you'll be in for the time of your life. My final note is, unfortunantely due the current state of VR, online mulitiplayer is lacking, however this isn't to fault Survios, because they put out an amazing game with immense replayability and a sizeable amount of content for the price. Sprint Vector is a solid game with loads of content and should be a mainstay for any VR user.
With Virtual Desktop. Actual drivers. ASUS ROG Strix Scar 15 Laptop with RTX 3080 115+W, Ryzen 7 5800H, 16GB RAM. What is wrong here?
I truly feel this is the pinnacle of VR gaming. It's incredibly fun, utilizes the most of physical movement, and it is bursting with character and fun visuals. It's Perfect.

review_title: jetset radio is back in vr!
one_reviews_text: If you grew up on jetset radio future you will love this game desgin and musical vibe and thrilling sensation of areana races, and a large practice skate park. You skate with roller blades and move your hands in that fashion in order to move about. IT is everything I want in a vr game, adrenline but the lack of practice can make anyone easily frustrated in this game. Give it some serious practice to get the skating arms movement and timing right, it's def a workout. Compared to most vr comfort levels. it say this i scales 5/5 but just be aware of your play space

this coupd be a perfect game for quest support....i hope there is an chance to bring it out....
the multiplayer could grow with quest
I'll play it more once i get my 3rd rift sensor. i'll update my review then.

Bought this game for my son and watched him struggle with the running mechanic. Everything else seemed to work ok, but the running mechanics are just awful, I'm sure with alot of practice it would get easier but I just think it could have been better implemented somehow. He ended up quiting the game half way through the first race and I honesty didn't blame him, it looked like a real struggle to play. Other than that the game production is top notch, too bad.

Great movement mechanics, when you get the hang of it and can string all the moves together seamlessly it's very rewarding and a good workout to boot. I haven't tried playing online yet but for the price I would be happy with just the single player experience.

This game is super fun and I straight suck at it right now. I know eventually I will get better but this game is amazing, the locomotion is on point for the most part. You will lose some pounds if you play this game on a daily basis which I intend too lots of content for how much it was and once the online blows up its really gonna be a lot of fun. Dont doubt yourself just buy it.
this game is 5 stars its such a good game  you should definitely pick this up well it is on sale

review_title: Only met one other person on this game
one_reviews_text: They should not sell this game for that much is there is like no one to play against

I gave it a 5 star because the game runs smoothly, well polished, has good graphics, great controllers and amazing maps.
But if I could I would give a 1 star for the developers for making such a good game and then not updating it what so ever... The community and new customers would be attracted to the updates and play the game (and more purchases)... But that's something that the developers quit on... idk why..
there's a great deal on the game rn... but besides that there is nothing this game has to offer in the updates department...

review_title: Great game, but could have been a legend
one_reviews_text: This is a very fun game with tons of polish and LOADS of content, different courses with all sorts of different routes.   Also lots of movement mechanics so the skillcap is very high.  Unfortunately, the multiplayer is dead and didn't really work great even when it wasn't.  Add to that the AI isn't very good and there's no Mario Kart style "cups" where you get a total score across multiple races, so the single player is also lacking.  Overall I'd still recommend it, but I wish they had put more into the single player challenge/features.

This is not the type of game I'd usually go for, but saw the good reviews and thought I'd give it go.  The devs have obviously put in a lot of thought and care into this game.  The way that the controls are used makes it require considerable skill to play, and so progress is very satisfying.  I expect it will take me ages before I get even half competent.  And I can actually get some (much needed) exercise from playing a computer game; who'd have thought it? The only negative at the moment is that I haven't been able to find any online games in my region (EU).  But I've only tried twice, so that could be bad timing, or me doing something wrong.
UPDATE:  Had this for a good while now, and still think it's an excellent game.  However, I am very rarely able to find anyone else playing online (EU or US), so if that's your thing then it's a problem.

Don't be discouraged by some negative reviews. if you do the tutorials and make sure you actually understand them to your fullest then you'll have a blast playing this. Its the perfect competitive game for someone like me who struggled at other ones like Echo Arena and Sparc. Also has a great community, even if its small

Sprint Vector is an intense thrill-ride. Competitive obstacle course racing, power-ups, variety of quality tracks and characters, multi and single player modes, and a great style; it's sure to be a thrill for everyone.

review_title: Best Weight Loss VR to Date!
one_reviews_text: I burn more calories in this game than any other VR exercise game. If you are looking for a fun way to lose weight, this is the game you were looking for. To make it 100x more intense, but on 2 or 3 lb weighted gloves. Then each race will feel like running a mile!!!

I went through the tutorial levels and everything seemed like a lot of fun.  Then I got to the main races.  I've done about 10 races and everytime I've gotten stuck on something stupid.  Usually when I get stuck on something it takes about 15-30 seconds to get out.  Moving in all directions, jumping, etc. Costing that much time in a race makes it nearly impossible to win.  A couple races my character was just completely stuck and I had to quit the race.  I'll probably revisit this game in the future to see if these issues still exist but for now its too much frustration.

After all tutorials and during playing I must definitely say - this game is shame for Oculus Touch controllers. So bad, so frustrate, no optimalisation. I hate this game, not for great graphics and idea but for Oculus control - it is REALY bad. For me lost my money. (I recomand switch off braking, because during sprint are those buttons pressed by mistake),...but is not possible in settings make some more changes. Would be one result - if in setting menu will more modification for  Oculus Touch controls, because this one who projected buttons probably never play longer time by Oculus. Realy terrible playing. Same problems is turning buttons - you are running and by mistake lite touch...and all is lost. Evidently playable only on PS - evidently next platform control bugs is not interested for developers which do not listen users here.

NOBODY PLAYS THIS. I HATE YOU RIFT YOU STEAL MY MONEY!!!! 6-3-18 Sits in my library... "Last played 21 days ago", why? Because THERE IS NO ONE TO PLAY WITH!!!!!! -------------------- Besides the "free weekend" which led me to this purchase. I have done nothing but try to find others to play with. I can EASILY SEE THIS GAME IS DEAD. DO NOT WASTE YOUR $. stupid Rift has segregated the online community into their own proprietary community, but it is broken. Because there is never anyone else to play with. I hate wasting money on game after game only to find out it is a dead game like every game on Rift.

UPDATE: I've figured out vrlfg and learning something called discord to help find people to play with. Steam is where to buy games from, because that is where other people with all kinds of VR gear are playing. UPDATE: I HATE YOU RIFT!! THIS IS THEIVERY!!!!!! I REQUESTED A REFUND PRIOR TO THE 2 WEEKS! BUT BECAUSE OF THE "FREE WEEKEND" YOU DENY ME MY REFUND DUE TO PLAYTIME BEING OVER 2 HOURS!!! WHAT KIND OF SHADY BOLOGNA IS THIS!!???? $@!$@!!!! MO#$#@%%#@!!!!
Me and My brother consistently tire ourselves out after a long session. All-in-all, 5 stars from me.

Inspired by the Mario Kart and the Wipeout series, this new VR gem will make you sweat to the last drop if you really want to win. Great workout. Great tracks. Vibrant colours. But technically a bit difficult to master especially on the harder tracks. The racing mechanics are good but to make this an excellent game it would have to be more fluid. For example, in Mario Kart and Wipeout you need to master the optimal racing line on the tracks, and the racing mechanics definitely allows you to master them. In Sprint Vector, there are so many moving objects, pitfalls and roadblocks and the races are too long for an amateur player to really master a track. Also the, number of traps and pitfalls to dodge or avoid keeps you distracted from beating your opponents, and make the weapons a bit useless. Therefore, it skews the game intention of being a "racing" game to more of an arm bashing fest. Suggestion if not already implemented: Add a reset button to avoid all the pain of getting back on track when you're stuck.

review_title: High Quaity Stuff, but feels slow.
one_reviews_text: The game's presentation is top notch.  Tons of charm and polish, definitely one of the higher quality VR games out.  For me personally though it feels way too slow.  I'm a speed junky, my favorite games are F-Zero, Wipeout, and anything super fast.  I enjoyed the Killer Boost track, but I felt spoiled after playing it, now the rest of the game feels way too slow.  I want more Killer Boost.
This games gamneplay alone is good enough by itself but everything els combined makes it the best game I have played in VR

review_title: Can't find a match for the Gold Rush.
one_reviews_text: Try to queue for like 45 mins, still can't find a mutiple player match. Already tried out Europe and American services. Really need improve in match making system.

Just wanted to share the official statement from Oculus regarding today's Gold Rush Event: "Thanks for showing up today to play Sprint Vector. If you were unable to match during the Gold Rush hour, don’t worry. We'll make sure that those who played or waited to play and never matched will be entered into the drawing. We’re identifying winners and will notify next week."

We’re identifying winners and will notify next week."

review_title: One of the best - needs one major fix
one_reviews_text:
Easily one of my favorite vr games. There's a bit of a learning curve but once you get the hang of it you can't stop returning. Very fun and challenging.
But for the love of all that is sacred can the devs PLEASE make it so you can disable the Oculus home button? It ruins so many races for me. In a heated, frantic race it's much too easy to hit that button when you need to jump and then you're suddenly jerked out of the game.  It's incredibly frustrating. Some people have large hands. 
I'm begging you. Just provide the option to disable that button and it'll make it so much better.
Events online don't work and nobody is ever online.
review_feedback: Hey DavidReynolds321, Apologies for the server issues today! We're working with Oculus to have a makeup event for today's Gold Rush. *UPDATE* Hey again, Just wanted to share the official statement from Oculus regarding today's Gold Rush Event: "Thanks for showing up today to play Sprint Vector. If you were unable to match during the Gold Rush hour, don’t worry. We'll make sure that those who played or waited to play and never matched will be entered into the drawing. We’re identifying winners and will notify next week."

one_reviews_text: i played alot of game but this one maybe one of my favorite and will say its a must

review_title: Mirror's edge + the climb + mario kart
one_reviews_text: I'm glad that devs trying something new in vr. No more shooting gallery stuff! Game has a lot of content. Trials, single player, multi you won't be bored. Single player is very hard prepare to be the last one. You will need a lot of practicing. The biggest advantage of this game is the workout! You will exercise without knowing it by just simply playing the game how cool is that. No more boring workouts! Rift is the new kinect (in a good way).

This is a fanstastic racing game that has locomotion mechanics that I can only compare them to skiing. You skate about, racing your fellow players in various environments (volcanic maps to arctic, snowy maps etc.) to be the first to reach the finish line. The game can be compared to Mario Kart, in that there are power-ups that are littered around the map so that you can still stand a chance if you are lagging in 8th (last) place.

I only have 2 critisims: there plenty of maps but they can be covered within the first few hours and the other is that I wish that there was a way of customising your skates (giving them more speed, but less control-ability or better drift, but worse in-air control, etc.).

This is my first Survios game and I hope it won't be the last!

I love the attention that Survios put into getting the controls right. It's not as easy to pick up as something like Mario Kart, but once you finally learn the controls, it has a lot more depth to the game. 

I'm sure there will be a lot of players that will skip over the tutorials and start a race, only swinging their arms as fast as they could. While this is a decent workout, do yourself a favor and go through ALL the tutorials (not just the first one). Once you master the controls, you'll be flinging yourself accross the maps with a level of control and pure joy only super heros have. This is when the game really gets fun. 

The reason why motion control games on the Xbox Kinect and Wii never did well is because they weren't predictible enough to really spend a long time mastering (remember how most people cheated with the wii and just shook the controller instead of swinging it?). I'm happy to say Sprint Vector (along with many other excellent VR titles) have finally broken this mold and have created a game that has the predictibility in controls that all sports (and sport games) must have. This is truly a game that you can have fun playing from the beginning, but will also stretch your competitive side as there's so much room for growth in getting better. It also doesn't hurt that you get a great workout while having a ton of fun... :-)

I never review anything but I had to for this game. I'm so glad this had a free weekend because I had seen this on the store and would not have given it a chance. It's fun, intense, and looks awesome. I thought with all the fast movement there would be a ton of motion sickness, but there is none. Buy this and get ready for the most fun workout you've ever had playing a game.

The locomotion system system in this game is great! it does not get me to feel nauseated at all, and it feels amazing. But while the game itself is great, there is a lack of players in multiplayer matches to the point where you could be left looking for players in the lobby for more than 10 minutes. That is really the only downside, though.
I keep hitting the oculus menu button every time I try and jump. Completely ruins the game.

Definately the most fun I had in VR this year. The movement is so satysfing, the feeling of speed and abilities to jump, drift, climb and fly make it so engaging.
Kudos for both visual and gameplay direction!

love this game but multiplayer wasnt working at all during what should have been the most populated time, during the sweepstake, was searching for over 10 mins. seriously not happy about that. try again SV

Edit: just got a response from the devs so that was nice changing my rating back to 5 stars. Glad you guys care. Thanks for the response.

one_reviews_text: It's a fun game if you like racing games, i feel like its just hard though because its hard to turn without stoping or getting stuck into an object, also the mutliplayer never finds people, i thought there would be people on during the gold rush, so far been waiting for 30-40 minutes and got no one...

one_reviews_text: Over complicated levels stop you getting into the flow of the race. I haven't managed to join a multiplayer after many attempts. The idea is good but its bitty  ugly level design stop any fun happening.  I can't really recomend this, but am glad others are enjoying it and looking forward to seeing what elese the dev's come up with

got it on free weekend ended up buying i heard multiplayer didnt work and my internet is pretty bad so i was nervous but a friend of mine and i play online a lot and did fine really fun and has a bit of a learning curve but super satisfying when you get that perfect menouvor

Most exhilirating experience yet. initial learning curve for the controls is little steep, but incredibly and consistently satisfying once achieved. I was injured after a climbing incident, and I used Sprint Vector while I was healing. I went to sleep exhausted and satisfied every night.

With Oculus Duo Pack & 13,- Store credit for Rift bug  a week ago, got this wonderful game for Free, next to the eurly rift fanboy wich got eve valkary for free to, so double Free :-) Go Oculus Go, you Rule!

When the controls respond as they are supposed to, it's great. The first time I ran a couple of races, my biceps burned for two days, I loved it. The big problem is, the controls often don't do what you want, and the game is overly punitive when punishing mistakes. In the air, you should be able to fly: sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Those green walls? At the top you should be able to pull yourself up / jump up. Sometimes you can, sometimes you can't. You should be able to look the direction you want to go. That often has you sliding to the side, with no grip to change direction and crashing into a wall, and there is also no way that I can find to reset your position. You just have to finagle your way back on to the track, while everyone else shoots past you. There also doesn't appear to be a way to simply forfeit or restart a race; you have to struggle on or quit the app entirely. I never rage quit games, especially not VR games, but this one I've rage quit many times; it can be so unresponsive and so unfair and so punishing it's just not fun. When the controls respond, it's great and an astounding workout. When they don't, not so much. One other thing, they explicitly state you should not press the lower triggers as that will cause you to brake. That's a hard thing to avoid in the heat of a race.


UPDATE: It has now started doing a thing where the gloves on my hands will crackle with energy, and when that happens I can only run backwards (facing forwards but moving backwards). The thing is, it never goes away. Everyone else is at the finish line, and I'm only halfway done because I can't run forwards. This just started but has happened a couple of times, and the only option is to quit the app and restart.
review_feedback: Hey McNabb, apologies for the running backwards bug you're experiencing. Would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com regarding this issue? We'd love to help troubleshoot this problem with you, as well as gather information. Thank you for your patience!

one_reviews_text: But multiplayer only ever worked once for me, and I have the game purchased before the free weekend.
review_feedback: Hey sw33tp34, Apologies for these issues with Multiplayer you've been experiencing. If you're still unable to connect to any servers, please contact us at support@survios.com so we can help troubleshoot! Thank you for your patience

review_title: Best VR from a PUBG and Shooter lover
one_reviews_text: Its not pubg, its not anything like any racing game beforce because it can frustrate you and make you feel amazing about 1st place in a game once again. If you are saying you get stuck on walls or anything... u just arn't good yet, i stil yell every time i hit a wall and jump on accident or something.. in my last race i hit same wall, fixed it while shooting oncoming players easily. just takes some practice and basic tutorials! forreal, i also hate tuts but these were semi needed.

I've been having so much fun with this game. 30 minutes in this game gets your heart pumping and your body sweating. I was sore the next day. You get a rush while competing which makes you forget where you are. Highly recommended.

Pure adrenaline-fueled fun. That's what this game is about. It does such a great job at moving you around at high speeds with a really in-depth locomotion system that I'd love to see used in all kinds of other games. It's a step forward for VR, and may be one of those locomotion systems that becomes common over time with more games adapting it, like what I feel Lone Echo / Echo Arena achieved with Zero G movement.

A must play title. Well done Survios.

You won't even realize how much you're sweating...that's how good of a game this is. I won't parrot the same positives that others have mentioned. The only negative I could think is that, while it touts 12 maps to race on, there are really only 6 maps, and 6 in reverse (with some added obstacles), and all of this takes place over 3 different worlds/settings (ice, desert, factory). It's such an amazing mechanic that it leaves you wanting way more variety in levels than what is offered. Challenges are super fun and will keep you going for hours though. Still, for the $30 price tag that they're asking, it's a hell of a value. Hoping they release new maps, even if it's paid DLC. I'm hooked!

I am personally having a really hard time with the controls. Its very difficult not to press the grip button which slows down all momentum and speed.  I have practiced on the first beginner track for hours and still come in dead last. Maybe i am not physically able to play the game. But, the game looks and sounds wonderful. If i can get past my control issue i will rate it 5 stars.

review_title: This game is so much fun, but exhausting
one_reviews_text: This game feels awesome and plays awesome. However, I can not play more than an hour without taking a break. My body gets so sweaty and it feels like I have been out running. While this is good, it also makes me a little afraid that the playerbase may be low because the fact that people can not spend too many hours at a time in this game.

As a fan of Mario Kart, I love exhilirating, fast, multiplayer racing games. This feels like a combination of that, Jet Set Radio, and a VR parkour experience. 

It controls very well, but you might not feel like it at first; they definitely have a learning curve. It wasn't until my first few days after playing that I felt like I had an insane amount of control, and now I'm getting first place in most of my matches.

The power ups are useful, but don't feel unfair like blue shells in Mario Kart. The maps are better than Mario Kart as well, in my opinion. They're not as linear as most maps in racing games; there are a ton of secret passages, not just one alternate path.

This is also one of the most polished experiences, if not the most, that I've had in VR. At the price, it's worth it by far. The graphics are beautiful, the music is fantastic, and it controls very nice with no motion sickness. Expect a workout (my body was aching after the first few days), but you quickly get used to it. I can play longer than ever before without the fatigue that I used to get, and I'm not in shape by any meaning of the word (skinny, but not active).

I bought VR a few weeks ago, and I bought this game on release a few days after receiving my headset. Being new to VR, this is by far one of my favorite games, and I can't stop coming back to it. Definitely pick it up if you're considering it, and are a fan of Mario Kart + don't mind being a little more active than you're probably used to.

The game runs and plays great, one of the most fun games I have in VR.

also
I havent had any of the issues that other people have had like multiplayer not working

Even though I this game for free I now can say after playing and trying it out for myself that if I knew from the start that it is this good I would have paid for it. Great mechanics, neat graphics, controls handle perfect when you get the hang of it. A must buy

One of the greatest game on vr.  control aren't easy on the begining but once mastered you can do anything in this game. All track are awesome and you can praticaly do it your own way. Dont hesitate and buy it!

Excellent.

 It has a large learning curve but is very accessible to beginners. There are extensive tutorials that explain all of the ins and outs so you won't be racing blind from the jump. Challenges, Ai Racing, Multiplayer, this is the full package with a cartoony stylized cell shaded look.

 This game will make you tired after a bit, but it will pull you back in for more. 

Definitely a 5.
if ya like sprinting, with powerups and in a wierd arena, this is for you also if you want to loze weight this will work i beleve

review_title: One of the best multiplayer VR game
one_reviews_text: Beautiful, fluid, no motion sickness and incredibly fun. A must have if you are not affraid to workout.

https://www.reddit.com/r/oculus/comments/7wfcim/sprint_vector_all_12_tracks/

Survios have really put their knowledge of developing quality VR games to good use with this title.
Better known for their top rated and best selling action game Raw Data, this concept is a welcome change for VR  gamers.
This game is slick and polished from start to finish and I cannot praise it enough.
You need to swing your arms until they break so you can move a little ..
review_feedback: Hey FernandoCv1, apologies for the negative experience with the running mechanic. We were just curious if you got a chance to try Casual mode? If so, did you still endure this problem?

one_reviews_text: Make sure to have friends to play with - with that it is plenty fun
Pretty cool game. There's an initial steep learning curve, but once you get the hang of things you're gonna have a blast!  Play with players from Oculus Home and/or STEAMVR.
Tons of fun - an experience you can't really have outside of VR.

If you want to lose weight and have a hellton of fun at the same time, this is clearly the game for you. If you really put a lot of effort into it every inch of your arm muscle will be contracted. The developers deserve a big crown for this innovative and well polished game. A must have.

review_title: One of the best VR expiriences
one_reviews_text: This is one of the best vr expiriences, man, intense, actually make you MOVE yourself. The controls are quite intuitive safe for jumping, it is a bit weird and is not instantaneous. It is often a bit hard to see if you are hight enough to jump over something. Also I have some problems with turning and orientation. They are in no way critical but because I use front facing model, after a couple of turns, the orientation becomes muffled, i have to somehow recenter myself, but it is hard to do considering that sticks do not have fluid turning. This disorients me. Other than this couple of points, the games is awesome.

review_title: Really good fun - and a good workout
one_reviews_text: Great graphics and style, good fun gameplay, and an excellent workout for the arms too.  Grab it!

review_title: One of the best VR games right now
one_reviews_text:
Fell in love with this game when i realized they were artifically turning the player with NO MOTION SICKNESS. That's an amazing achievement by itself. The entire game is suprizingly comfortable, and runs great on a min spec machine (with lower graphics settings granted). The controls, the visual style, the polish, the soundtrack, all are great. Love the characters and constant banter between the announcers (Hilarious!). The multiplayer feels stable and solid. Best of all, the gameplay is FUN, and super addicting. 

Hats off to Survios. Great work guys.

You NEED this game. I play this game 1h at a time 4-5 times/week and it's a great workout. With so many modes, tracks challenges and secret passages this game will last a very long play time. The controls were weird for the first couple days (jump) but you get used to it and they quickly become natural. Downside? After acquiring this game I do not want to play any other game anymore...

This game is just fantastic. the movement and controls work really good. The music is nice inbeat with the movement.

The only thing this game needs is an endless mode or something. I want to run forever

The only thing that one make this game 100% perfect is adding in a Shadow the Hedgehog character model, so you could use his rocket skates in VR.  I would waste my last dying wish on that.

Other than that, I'm debating cancelling my Planet Fitness membership because everytime I play this game I literally have to shower afterwards.

review_title: Amazed for not being (vr) sick of it
one_reviews_text: Why I'm not getting any vr sickness from this game??? It is a great mistery to me. The game is really fast paced, I literaly jump, glide, slide, move faster then my fat butt would allow me in a real life. And yet I'm not feeling sick at all. I'm usually really sensitive to any motion in vr, and so I condemn myself to standing experiences. But this is something different, it feels great. I guess they gonna have hard time convincing people like me it's not going to kill them... It is also great workout, I really feel tired after few rounds. Controls are very extraordinary, and when first time I saw it I though  it doesn't look (feels) right at all. But I give it a try, and a few more... And it does feel real, after your body gets the hang of it. Graphics are great, love the character arts. Part of intro of this game looks like "link start(o)" from SAO. Posibilities are endless, that what I call a good gameplay mechanics. I'm getting tired fast, but i love it, still can't stand it for more than a 1.5 hour. But it's good for me, don't have more time to spare, I'm not kid anymore and have to feed my own :) Love It, would definitly buy it for fair price.

This game takes quiet some time to get the hang off the different mechanics but stick with it and you will be rewarded a truly immersive game. The game is a mix of Mario Kart and a full work out. I kid you not you will work up a sweat in this game. The only minor problem i have with the game is that it is way to easy to accidentally press the break button in the heat of the race, but that's probably a me thing.

first the good things:
-pretty ok grafics
-pumped up atmosphere
-its kind of a workout

no the thinks i dont like:
-the racer controlles realy bad, turning in this game is hard and unintuitiv
-if you get off track you loos about 5 seconds to recover, this almost breaks the game
-you are constantly airbourne and then can bearly control your movement
-flying decreases your speed so you realy dont want that, but it happens all the time if you want it or not

Well worth the money. Controls are weird to learn at first but once you learn them the game kicks up a ton. Would have liked to see some more beginner courses but thats okay.

Update - weapons need a major rework. They reward who ever is in first and punish everyone that is grouped up. This game needs something like the mario kart blue shell to actually make the race interesting instead of rewarding the player in first way ahead of everyone else. I think the ability that completely stops all functions should be geared towards 1st place and no other position.

As someone who gets motion sickness easily, i'm super surprised this doesn't cause discomfort.  The tutorial did a little, because you are going slow to learn the controls, but once in a race, my body is way to active to notice anything out of the ordinary... i guess thats how it might work :)...  

Anywho, the controls are difficult at first, but after practicing on the challenge maps, I'm now placing in the top 3 each round.  Super fun and innovative game!

I really like the game, it's highly polished with a lot of attention to gameplay, controls, art and so on... After playing all the tutorials (basic, advanced, expert) and racing against AI on 2 tracks, there is still something that push me against it. That would be "too much", too much of different gameplays... You can skate, jump, double jump, turn, fly, brake, brake in the air, drift, adjust your drifting angle, shoot, grab boosters, climb, hang. And when I say you can do all of this, it's more like you have to. The game with just skating, braking, jumping and drifting would have been great, maybe more like a "futuristic" skiing game... Still I would recommand this game to anyone to try, it may perfectly fit you and keep you fit!

Only played about 3-4 hours so far(yeah yeah i'm not as fit as i once was!)
But its impressive to say the least.
The most physical game I've played to date but obviously its up to you how much you push yourself(don't expect to win too many races though without real effort though)
Controls/locomotion are great,genuine skill is involved and you will still be improving your technique and subsequently your best times week and months from now(especially as you'll get fitter the more you practice)
After a few races you'll be sweating buckets but at least you'll have a smile on your face(heaps more fun than running on a treadmill).
Probably the best VR only game I've played and well worth the relativley cheap price.

Only minus points i can think of are,i dont care much for the cartoon style graphics and i would expect slightly better performance with such unambitious graphics.Thats all though and it wont stop me giving it 5*'s
waited one hour for a online match...wasted my time
review_feedback:
Hey marioaoki, Apologies for the server issues today! We're working with Oculus to have a makeup event for today's Gold Rush.
*UPDATE* Hey again, Just wanted to share the official statement from Oculus regarding today's Gold Rush Event: "Thanks for showing up today to play Sprint Vector. If you were unable to match during the Gold Rush hour, don’t worry. We'll make sure that those who played or waited to play and never matched will be entered into the drawing. We’re identifying winners and will notify next week."

one_reviews_text: Training was fun, but in my first real race I just got a black screen and couldn't see anything....... Feels unfinished. Also the physics are weird. Why do I fall so fast?
review_feedback: Hey AlphaRay, apologies for this black-screen issue you're experiencing with the game. Would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com so we could help troubleshoot this issue? Thank you for your patience!

one_reviews_text:
Title says it all.

Edit: Not sure where the error lies but if I put the HMD (Rift) everything goes black. Sound is still there but pitch black. Have to reboot computer so I'm blaming drivers. Currently running Nvidia driver 390.77 on a GTX 970. EDIT2: YA FIX THIS ASAP!

At first, this game is quite hard to grasp and you feel like you are doing terribly in the races. However, once you have done all the tutorials and recognise all the maps the game is super fun! Definitely recommend this to anyone.

I just started playing the game, doing time trials to get my skills up before I do multiplayer, and let me just tell you that this game is totally worth the money. I've kind of been playing... non stop for the last 5 hours...
got duo pack with eve Valkyrie both games stutter and lose connection with sensors other games are fine
review_feedback: Hey Excocet, would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com to help troubleshoot these performance issues you're experiencing with Sprint Vector?

one_reviews_text: Gameplay is fun and original. No other game uses the touch control this way. It is a real workout too, not simply a game, you will sweat a lot in here! I had motion sickness in my first play time though, hope to overcome it with time, but I think this will be the case,  since it already happened with other motion intense games I have. This game has a lot of potential!

review_title: Ranks up there with the best of VR!
one_reviews_text: I've been having a lot of fun, especially in mp. The game has a good quality feel to it. The graphics are good, it runs well, I like the mechanics and controls, everything is just very well done in my opinion. There is a lot to take in first time playing this though, make sure to do tutorial and it'll probably take some time to get used to everything. The running is straight forward, but add in jumping, braking, power ups, flying, and obstacles and it can be overwhelming until you really get the hang of it. It's not easy, but it is rewarding. Is it perfect? No, and no game is, but it's really good though. Only beta people will see this so it doesn't matter but it's going to the template for my actual review anyway.
I cannot feel my arms anymore.
Awesome Workout. LOL
AAA quality and a blast to play! Just buy the game already!

First day playing, played for 3 hours straight. Controls and movement system are top notch, on par with Echo Arena. Don't forget about double jumping, it saves a lot of frustration. Gave me more of a sweat than SuperHot and Sparc!

More than just sprint racing, climbing, parkour, extreme workout with an awesome presentation that hearks back to the old days of SSX and JSR. Sub $30 is a steal! Just make sure you clear your play area before you play!
The first vr game i've seen that make great use of the locomotion. Really requires alot skill to win a race. I rate it 20/10.
It really does feel like you are working out...you are moving 100% of the time.  Awesome VR game....shows the true power of the technology.  Need more of this!

review_title: VR Killer App in the making
one_reviews_text:
A cross between kinect sports, mirrors edge and JSRF in VR.

I dig it.

review_title: This game is amazing -already a new fave
one_reviews_text: Oh man, Sprint Vector is so sugoi! Much better than I had anticipated, and quite the workout if you are doing a longer session of it, really trying to beat the competition
Fun gameplay and an awesome cardio workout. Another gem that makes Oculus worth having at home.
I love it. You get sweaty and stinky after few rounds but it's so much fun. Polished product, must buy!
AAA+ game

review_title: Super fun, worth the sub $30 price
one_reviews_text: what a workout, super fun, the graphics are nice and smooth, my arms hurt typing this, buy it please!
love it! i feel like the flash! gotta go!
I feel like my arms are going to fall off but I'm having too much fun to stop. Send help.

review_title: One of the best games so far
one_reviews_text: Its basically mario kart on LSD and it is amazing!! A must have for everyone who can handle motion sickness or doesnt have that problem !!
If you're not a fast, sexy, jet-setter, this game is not for you.  []-)
I personally think the controlls are challenging.
start your year off right with this traedmill.  Got WATER !!!
Game feels great and plays great. One of the best vr games on the market. :)
This has the best gameplay of any VR game I've played so far
its nice i like it
